sources.title: Physical modeling of ember transport distances
sources.snippet: Experimental studies show that embers can travel up to 35 km ahead of the main fire front under extreme conditions. Eucalyptus bark is particularly prone to generating long-distance firebrands.
sources.query: Research ember spotting distances and firebrand transport mechanisms in extreme wildfire conditions

sources.title: Firebrand spotting: Mechanisms and modeling approaches
sources.snippet: Recent advances in computational fluid dynamics allow better prediction of ember trajectories. Wind speed, fire intensity, and vegetation type are key factors.

sources.title: Ember transport and spotting in wildfires: A review
sources.snippet: Ember transport and subsequent ignition of spot fires is a major mechanism for wildfire spread. This review examines the physics of ember generation, lofting, transport, and ignition.
